intro: Ludwigia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to Central and South America and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and streams. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in spikes. Ludwigia pubescens is often used in aquatic gardening and can serve as a food source for certain aquatic animals.
